instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt0000089AekMAE
input: Can this lead be qualified based on the latest discussions? If the answer is no, which factors—'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline'—are responsible? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Id, Body__c, CreatedDate, LeadId__c FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt0000089AekMAE' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC LIMIT 10 </execute>
query_results:
Salesforce instance output: [{'Id': 'a05Wt000003SukEIAS', 'Body__c': "[2023-10-21T10:02:00] Ava Sullivan: Hi Ali, this is Ava Sullivan from TechSolutions. How are you today?
[2023-10-21T10:02:10] Ali Hussein: Hi Ava, I'm doing well, thank you. How about you?
[2023-10-21T10:02:20] Ava Sullivan: I'm great, thank you for asking! I'm glad we could connect. I was looking over the details you provided about your interest in the PulseSim Pro. Is now a good time to discuss?
[2023-10-21T10:02:30] Ali Hussein: Yes, now works for me. I'm interested to learn more and see how it fits with what we need.
[2023-10-21T10:02:40] Ava Sullivan: Fantastic! From what you’ve mentioned, you’re interested in four units of the PulseSim Pro, correct?
[2023-10-21T10:02:50] Ali Hussein: That's right. We want to enhance our simulation capabilities, and the PulseSim Pro seems like a great fit.
[2023-10-21T10:03:05] Ava Sullivan: Absolutely. The PulseSim Pro is one of our top products for high precision simulation. It offers advanced analytics and seamless integration with existing systems, which is great for boosting efficiency.
[2023-10-21T10:03:15] Ali Hussein: Those features sound beneficial. We do have a tight timeline for installation, though. Could you tell me more about that?
[2023-10-21T10:03:30] Ava Sullivan: Certainly. We understand the importance of meeting tight schedules. We usually aim to complete installations within a day and ensure everything runs smoothly. Our technical team is very efficient.
[2023-10-21T10:03:40] Ali Hussein: That’s reassuring. And as for the budget, how does it look for four units?
[2023-10-21T10:03:55] Ava Sullivan: Considering your budget is $2,261, I think we can work something out. Each PulseSim Pro unit is priced at $500. For four units, it will come to $2,000. This is below your budget, leaving room for additional services if you wish.
[2023-10-21T10:04:10] Ali Hussein: That fits really well. I'd like to move forward, but I'll need to consult with the finance team here since I don’t have the final say.
[2023-10-21T10:04:20] Ava Sullivan: I completely understand, Ali. Would you like me to send over a detailed proposal and pricing information so you can present it to your team?
[2023-10-21T10:04:25] Ali Hussein: Yes, please. That would be very helpful.
[2023-10-21T10:04:35] Ava Sullivan: Great! I'll have that to you by the end of the day. Is there anything else you would need from my side?
[2023-10-21T10:04:40] Ali Hussein: No, that sounds good for now. Thank you, Ava.
[2023-10-21T10:04:50] Ava Sullivan: You're welcome, Ali. If any questions come up, feel free to reach out. Have a wonderful day!
[2023-10-21T10:04:55] Ali Hussein: Thanks, Ava. You too!", 'CreatedDate': '2023-10-21T10:02:00.000+0000', 'LeadId__c': '00QWt0000089AekMAE'}]

  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000897TuMAI
input: From the recent discussions with the lead, should this lead be classified as qualified? If not, which among 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' is the reason? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Body__c FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000897TuMAI' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC </execute>

instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000898l0MAA
input: Based on the lead's recent interactions, is this lead suitable for qualification? If not, which of 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' are the reasons for disqualification? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Id, Body__c, CreatedDate FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000898l0MAA' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC </execute>

[2023-10-15T10:03:45] Youssef El-Amin: You too, Jorge. Bye!", 'CreatedDate': '2023-10-15T10:00:00.000+0000'}]

input: After reviewing the lead's recent discussions, should this lead be considered qualified? If they are not, which of the following factors are reasons: 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline'? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Id, Body__c, LeadId__c FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt000008989sMAA' </execute>

Salesforce instance output: [{'Id': 'a05Wt000003SxjdIAC', 'Body__c': "[2023-10-20T10:00:01] Dariusz Wisniewski: Hello, this is Dariusz Wisniewski calling from Energetix Solutions. Am I speaking with Raj Patel?
[2023-10-20T10:00:07] Raj Patel: Yes, this is Raj speaking. How can I help you today?
[2023-10-20T10:00:18] Dariusz Wisniewski: Great, thank you for taking the time to speak with me today, Raj. I wanted to discuss your interest in our solutions, specifically the OptiEnergy Suite, CollabCircuit Hub, and CollabDesign Studio. Is this a good time to chat?
[2023-10-20T10:00:24] Raj Patel: Absolutely, I've been looking forward to learning more about your products.
[2023-10-20T10:00:31] Dariusz Wisniewski: Fantastic! Let’s start with the OptiEnergy Suite. You mentioned an interest in acquiring four units, is that correct?
[2023-10-20T10:00:38] Raj Patel: Yes, that’s right. We're specifically looking to optimize our energy consumption.
[2023-10-20T10:00:52] Dariusz Wisniewski: The OptiEnergy Suite is perfect for that. It’s designed to streamline your energy use, reducing costs by up to 30%. It includes AI-driven analytics for real-time insights. Would that align with your goals?
[2023-10-20T10:01:05] Raj Patel: Sounds promising. I’d like to know more about the installation timeline, as we're on a tight schedule and aim to complete it within three days.
[2023-10-20T10:01:22] Dariusz Wisniewski: Understood. We're committed to meeting tight deadlines, and our professional team can certainly manage the setup within your desired timeframe. We’ll handle everything from inspection to implementation while ensuring minimal disruption to your operations.
[2023-10-20T10:01:34] Raj Patel: That's reassuring. How about the pricing? You mentioned reducing costs; what's the upfront cost looking like?
[2023-10-20T10:01:52] Dariusz Wisniewski: Great question, Raj. The pricing for the OptiEnergy Suite is highly competitive, especially when you consider the long-term savings. However, with your current budget of $3,203, we can explore potential discounts or financing options to accommodate this.
[2023-10-20T10:02:06] Raj Patel: That would be very helpful since I don't have full financial authority to approve large expenses. Are there other benefits I should be aware of?
[2023-10-20T10:02:22] Dariusz Wisniewski: Of course. Besides cost savings, the OptiEnergy Suite enhances operational efficiency and improves sustainability, which is crucial in today's business environment. Let me also touch on the CollabCircuit Hub, which you’ve shown interest in.
[2023-10-20T10:02:31] Raj Patel: Sure, I'm interested in how the CollabCircuit Hub can facilitate better collaboration.
[2023-10-20T10:02:49] Dariusz Wisniewski: The CollabCircuit Hub enables seamless communication across teams, essential for businesses prioritizing effective teamwork. It integrates easily with systems you likely already use, and can substantially increase productivity. Interested in knowing more about how it can transform your operations?
[2023-10-20T10:02:57] Raj Patel: Definitely. We’re always looking to improve team collaboration.
[2023-10-20T10:03:10] Dariusz Wisniewski: Perfect. And for the CollabDesign Studio, which you’re considering one unit of—it's ideal for high-quality design projects that require precision and creativity.
[2023-10-20T10:03:17] Raj Patel: Just one unit for now. We want to test its effectiveness before expanding.
[2023-10-20T10:03:30] Dariusz Wisniewski: That makes sense. It’s a powerhouse for design tasks, and we’re confident you’ll find it quite transformative. Would you like to discuss how we can move forward and address any more concerns?
[2023-10-20T10:03:39] Raj Patel: Not right now. I’ll need to discuss internally before making any decisions.
[2023-10-20T10:03:53] Dariusz Wisniewski: Absolutely. I'll send over detailed proposals for each product, including pricing and implementation specifics, which you can then review with your team. If any questions arise, feel free to reach out.
[2023-10-20T10:04:00] Raj Patel: That sounds great. Thank you for your help, Dariusz.
[2023-10-20T10:04:07] Dariusz Wisniewski: My pleasure, Raj. I look forward to working with you. Have a great day!
[2023-10-20T10:04:11] Raj Patel: You too, bye for now.", 'LeadId__c': '00QWt000008989sMAA'}]

Contract

VoiceCallTranscript__c

Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format

  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task

Event

UserTerritory2Association

Lead

instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object

  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']

Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event

  - Location: Location of the event

  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object

Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead

input: Considering the lead's recent interactions, should we qualify this lead? If not, is it due to 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline'? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').

[2023-10-21T10:00:05] Carlos Martinez: Hi Yuki, this is Carlos speaking. How can I help you today?

[2023-10-21T10:00:20] Carlos Martinez: Yes, that's right. I'm considering purchasing two SimulateX Edge units and one UnitySim Essentials.
[2023-10-21T10:00:30] Yuki Kato: Great! Before we dive into details, do you have a specific need or project you're planning that these products would be used for?
[2023-10-21T10:00:40] Carlos Martinez: Well, to be honest, I don’t have a very clear need yet. I'm just exploring possibilities for some future expansions in our operations.
[2023-10-21T10:00:50] Yuki Kato: I see! It's always good to stay ahead of the curve. Just to clarify, how soon are you looking to have everything set up and running?
[2023-10-21T10:01:00] Carlos Martinez: Ideally, we want to finish the installation within a day after purchase. Our schedule is quite packed, and we want minimal disruption.
[2023-10-21T10:01:10] Yuki Kato: That's absolutely understandable. Our team is quite efficient with installations, but just to confirm, would that timeline align with your current operations?
[2023-10-21T10:01:18] Carlos Martinez: Yes, it should be fine. I have the authority to make financial decisions so as long as it fits our budget, we can proceed quickly.
[2023-10-21T10:01:30] Yuki Kato: Perfect. Speaking of budget, our SimulateX Edge is priced competitively at $800 per unit and the UnitySim Essentials comes at $450. That would bring your total to $2,050 before any applicable discounts.
[2023-10-21T10:01:45] Carlos Martinez: I see. The price is a bit over my initial budget of $1,688. Are there any discounts or options available to accommodate this?
[2023-10-21T10:02:00] Yuki Kato: Let me see what we can do. Since you're interested in multiple units and have the potential for future purchases, I can offer a bundled discount, bringing the total closer to your budget at approximately $1,700. How does that sound?
[2023-10-21T10:02:15] Carlos Martinez: That sounds much better. Could you also tell me a bit about how these products might benefit our operations? As I mentioned, I’m just exploring options, so any insights would be helpful.
[2023-10-21T10:02:30] Yuki Kato: Absolutely, Carlos. The SimulateX Edge is designed to streamline and optimize your workflows with advanced simulation capabilities, while the UnitySim Essentials package ensures you have the foundational tools needed for seamless integration. These together enhance productivity and accuracy, which could be a great asset for any expansion you’re considering.
[2023-10-21T10:02:45] Carlos Martinez: I appreciate that explanation, Yuki. It does sound like it could be beneficial down the road.
[2023-10-21T10:02:55] Yuki Kato: Glad to hear it, Carlos. Would you like me to draft up the details in a formal proposal and send it over? That way you can review everything at your leisure before making a decision.
[2023-10-21T10:03:02] Carlos Martinez: Yes, that would be great. I look forward to seeing it.
[2023-10-21T10:03:10] Yuki Kato: Wonderful. I'll have that sent over by the end of the day. If you have any other questions in the meantime, feel free to reach out. Thank you for your time today, Carlos.
[2023-10-21T10:03:20] Carlos Martinez: Thanks, Yuki. I appreciate the detailed information. Talk to you soon!
[2023-10-21T10:03:25] Yuki Kato: My pleasure. Have a great day!", 'CreatedDate': '2023-10-21T10:00:00.000+0000'}]

  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object

  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object

Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format

  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format

VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000895NIMAY

Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
