You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

User

  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to

  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product

ProductCategoryProduct

Pricebook2

PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry

  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object

  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item

  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered

  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object

  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended

  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object

  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object

  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object

  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000897P6MAI
input: Considering the recent discussions with the lead, should this lead be considered qualified? If not, which factors among 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' are the reasons? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Body__c FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000897P6MAI' </execute>

[2023-10-05T10:00:25] Hiroshi Tanaka: Yes, I do. I've been looking into ways to improve our data security, and the SecureData Nexus caught my attention.
[2023-10-05T10:00:36] Tariq Hassan: That's great to hear. The SecureData Nexus is an excellent choice for robust data protection. It offers advanced encryption features and seamless integration with existing IT infrastructures.
[2023-10-05T10:00:48] Hiroshi Tanaka: That's exactly what we need. How soon could we get it installed?
[2023-10-05T10:00:58] Tariq Hassan: We can typically accommodate quick installations. You mentioned wanting it installed within a day, and we can certainly aim for that.
[2023-10-05T10:01:08] Hiroshi Tanaka: Perfect. And what are the costs involved?
[2023-10-05T10:01:18] Tariq Hassan: The SecureData Nexus is priced at $500, which fits within your stated budget of $517. This includes full installation and a year of support services.
[2023-10-05T10:01:28] Hiroshi Tanaka: Good. I'm glad it fits our budget. What are the payment terms?
[2023-10-05T10:01:38] Tariq Hassan: We offer flexible payment options. You can pay upfront, or we can set up a payment plan that works for your finance team.
[2023-10-05T10:01:47] Hiroshi Tanaka: I think upfront might be easier to manage. Which means we'd need an invoice soon.
[2023-10-05T10:01:58] Tariq Hassan: Absolutely, I can send over the invoice as soon as we finalize the order details. Do you have any other questions or concerns about the product or the process?
[2023-10-05T10:02:08] Hiroshi Tanaka: You've covered most of it. Just one more thing—how's the customer support for this product?
[2023-10-05T10:02:18] Tariq Hassan: Our customer support is top-notch, available 24/7 with dedicated professional technicians ready to assist you with any queries you might encounter during or after installation.
[2023-10-05T10:02:27] Hiroshi Tanaka: That sounds reassuring. I believe we're ready to move forward then.
[2023-10-05T10:02:37] Tariq Hassan: Fantastic, Hiroshi. I'll prepare the documentation and send over your invoice today. We can proceed with scheduling the installation once the payment is confirmed.
[2023-10-05T10:02:45] Hiroshi Tanaka: Great, looking forward to it. Thank you for your help, Tariq.
[2023-10-05T10:02:55] Tariq Hassan: Thank you, Hiroshi. I'm glad we could assist you. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any more questions. Have a great day!
[2023-10-05T10:03:00] Hiroshi Tanaka: You too, bye."}]

  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt000008981lMAA
input: From the latest discussions, is this lead eligible for qualification? If they are not, should 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' be the disqualifying factors? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Body__c FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt000008981lMAA' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC LIMIT 1 </execute>

[2023-10-03T10:00:08] Yuki Tanaka: Yes, this is Yuki. And you must be Noura. How are you today?
[2023-10-03T10:00:15] Noura Haddad: Yes, this is Noura Haddad. I'm doing well, thank you for asking. How about yourself?
[2023-10-03T10:00:22] Yuki Tanaka: Doing good, thanks. So, let's dive into it. I understand we're discussing some products from your line?
[2023-10-03T10:00:30] Noura Haddad: Absolutely. I see you're interested in our DevVision IDE and SimuCheck Ultra. Is that correct?
[2023-10-03T10:00:38] Yuki Tanaka: Yes, that's right. I'm looking at 4 licenses for DevVision IDE and 1 for SimuCheck Ultra.
[2023-10-03T10:00:50] Noura Haddad: Great choices. DevVision IDE is known for its robust features tailored for developers, and SimuCheck Ultra provides top-notch simulation and testing capabilities. May I ask what your primary use cases are for these?
[2023-10-03T10:01:05] Yuki Tanaka: We're ramping up our development team and need a reliable IDE. The SimuCheck Ultra will be used for system simulation to streamline our testing process.
[2023-10-03T10:01:20] Noura Haddad: That makes perfect sense. Our DevVision IDE will certainly boost your team's productivity with its seamless integration and debugging tools. And SimuCheck Ultra is excellent for cutting down the time spent on testing with its real-time simulation features.
[2023-10-03T10:01:32] Yuki Tanaka: Those sound promising. Can you tell me more about the pricing and if we can meet our budget which is around $1461?
[2023-10-03T10:01:50] Noura Haddad: Certainly. For the four licenses of DevVision IDE, you're looking at around $960, and the single SimuCheck Ultra is approximately $500. So, combined, it comes to $1,460, which fits nicely within your budget.
[2023-10-03T10:02:10] Yuki Tanaka: That's good to hear. We definitely need to stick to that budget. And how soon could we get these installed? We’re hoping to have everything set within 3 days.
[2023-10-03T10:02:25] Noura Haddad: We can certainly accommodate that timeline. Once we've finalized the order today, our team can handle the installation process right away. Typically, it’s a straightforward process and can be completed promptly.
[2023-10-03T10:02:38] Yuki Tanaka: Great. Just to clarify, the installation support—does that include any training or manuals?
[2023-10-03T10:02:50] Noura Haddad: Absolutely, we provide detailed manuals and our support team can offer a brief online training session if needed. Anything to ensure your team gets up to speed quickly.
[2023-10-03T10:03:02] Yuki Tanaka: That's reassuring. I believe that covers all I needed to know from a product standpoint. Anything else on your end?
[2023-10-03T10:03:15] Noura Haddad: Just a quick note that this package and support will ensure you get the optimal use of our solutions right from the start. We also offer follow-up services to cater to any evolving needs.
[2023-10-03T10:03:23] Yuki Tanaka: Perfect. I think we are ready to proceed with placing the order.
[2023-10-03T10:03:32] Noura Haddad: Fantastic. I'll send over the paperwork along with a summary of what we've discussed. It’s been a pleasure working with you, Yuki.
[2023-10-03T10:03:39] Yuki Tanaka: Likewise, Noura. Looking forward to a smooth installation process.
[2023-10-03T10:03:45] Noura Haddad: We'll make sure of that. Have a great day, Yuki.
[2023-10-03T10:03:49] Yuki Tanaka: You too. Goodbye."}]

instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000899CLMAY
input: Considering the lead's recent discussions, should this lead be considered qualified? If not, which of the following: 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline', are the reasons? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Id, LeadId__c, Body__c FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000899CLMAY' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC LIMIT 10 </execute>

[2023-10-15T10:00:08] Yuki Nakamura: Hi, yes, this is Yuki Nakamura speaking.

[2023-10-15T10:00:50] Yuki Kato: That makes sense. SecuManage Pro is designed to provide robust security features and ease of management across multiple sites. It includes real-time monitoring and an advanced threat detection system. How do you feel that fits with your needs?

[2023-10-15T10:01:08] Yuki Nakamura: Yes, that's right.
[2023-10-15T10:01:15] Yuki Kato: Excellent. With your budget, we can comfortably provide the three units of SecuManage Pro and also ensure a seamless installation. Speaking of which, you mentioned you’d like the installation completed within one day. Is there a specific timeline you're targeting?
[2023-10-15T10:01:20] Yuki Nakamura: If possible, we'd aim to have everything set up by next Friday. Can that be accommodated?
[2023-10-15T10:01:29] Yuki Kato: We can definitely work with that timeline. Our installation team is quite efficient and we'll ensure the process causes minimal disruption to your operations.
[2023-10-15T10:01:33] Yuki Nakamura: That's reassuring to hear.
[2023-10-15T10:01:38] Yuki Kato: Great. Before we finalize everything, do you have any other questions or concerns that I can address?
[2023-10-15T10:01:42] Yuki Nakamura: Just one question. How user-friendly is the new system? My team isn't very tech-savvy.
[2023-10-15T10:01:50] Yuki Kato: Good question. The SecuManage Pro is designed with an intuitive, user-friendly interface, so your team should find it easy to navigate. Plus, we offer comprehensive training sessions to get everyone up to speed.
[2023-10-15T10:01:57] Yuki Nakamura: That’s very helpful. I think this is exactly what we need.
[2023-10-15T10:02:03] Yuki Kato: Excellent. I'll prepare the proposal and send it to you by the end of the day. We can then schedule everything as planned.
[2023-10-15T10:02:08] Yuki Nakamura: Sounds perfect. Thank you so much, Yuki.
[2023-10-15T10:02:12] Yuki Kato: You're welcome, Yuki. Thank you for your time and I look forward to working together. Have a great day!
[2023-10-15T10:02:15] Yuki Nakamura: You too! Bye for now."}]

You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.

- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object

  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000897wvMAA
input: Considering the most recent discussions with the lead, should this lead be considered qualified? If not, what are the reasons among 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline'? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Body__c, CreatedDate FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000897wvMAA' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC </execute>
query_results:
Salesforce instance output: [{'Body__c': "[2023-10-01T10:00:00] Nadia Al-Balushi: Good morning! Is this Fatima Al-Mansouri?
[2023-10-01T10:00:05] Fatima Al-Mansouri: Yes, this is Fatima. Who am I speaking with?
[2023-10-01T10:00:10] Nadia Al-Balushi: Hello Fatima, this is Nadia Al-Balushi from SecureTech Solutions. How are you doing today?
[2023-10-01T10:00:15] Fatima Al-Mansouri: Hi, Nadia. I'm doing well, thank you. And yourself?
[2023-10-01T10:00:20] Nadia Al-Balushi: I'm great, thank you for asking. I'm reaching out because I see you're interested in our CryptGuard Module. Could you tell me a little more about what you're looking for?
[2023-10-01T10:00:30] Fatima Al-Mansouri: Yes, I've been considering some security solutions, and the CryptGuard Module caught my eye, though I'm not sure how it might fit into what we're currently doing.
[2023-10-01T10:00:40] Nadia Al-Balushi: I understand. The CryptGuard Module is designed to enhance your overall data security with robust encryption features. What kind of security measures do you currently have in place?
[2023-10-01T10:00:50] Fatima Al-Mansouri: We're using some basic firewalls and antivirus software, but nothing too advanced in terms of encryption.
[2023-10-01T10:01:00] Nadia Al-Balushi: Got it. The CryptGuard could definitely be a good fit then. It's specifically crafted to seamlessly integrate with existing systems and enhance data protection without causing any disruptions.
[2023-10-01T10:01:10] Fatima Al-Mansouri: That sounds interesting. I'm concerned about the cost though. We have a budget limit of 548 for this.
[2023-10-01T10:01:20] Nadia Al-Balushi: That's precisely within our pricing range for a single module. We pride ourselves on offering competitive pricing combined with top-tier security features.
[2023-10-01T10:01:30] Fatima Al-Mansouri: Okay, that's good to know. How quickly can it be installed? We want it set up as soon as possible, ideally within a day.
[2023-10-01T10:01:40] Nadia Al-Balushi: Installation can indeed be completed within a single day. Our team works efficiently to ensure minimal downtime so your operations are uninterrupted.
[2023-10-01T10:01:50] Fatima Al-Mansouri: Excellent. And I'll have the final say on the purchase, so that won't be an issue. Can you tell me more about some specific benefits I can expect?
[2023-10-01T10:02:00] Nadia Al-Balushi: Absolutely. Besides the superior encryption, the CryptGuard provides real-time data analytics and threat detection. It helps in identifying potential issues before they become problematic.
[2023-10-01T10:02:10] Fatima Al-Mansouri: That sounds really useful. We haven't had specific issues, but it's always a concern.
[2023-10-01T10:02:20] Nadia Al-Balushi: I completely understand. Proactive security measures are always better than reactive ones. Also, we offer 24/7 customer support, should you need assistance at any point.
[2023-10-01T10:02:30] Fatima Al-Mansouri: That's reassuring. I think this could be a good step forward for us, even if we don't have a particular need right now.
[2023-10-01T10:02:40] Nadia Al-Balushi: I'm glad to hear that. Security is an evolving need, and it's always better to be prepared. Do you have any other questions or concerns at this point?
[2023-10-01T10:02:50] Fatima Al-Mansouri: No, I think you've covered all the bases for now. What are the next steps?
[2023-10-01T10:03:00] Nadia Al-Balushi: Great! I'll send you a formal proposal with all the details. Once you're ready, we can schedule the installation at your earliest convenience.
[2023-10-01T10:03:10] Fatima Al-Mansouri: Perfect, Nadia. Thank you for the information. I'll review everything and get back to you soon.
[2023-10-01T10:03:15] Nadia Al-Balushi: Thank you, Fatima. I look forward to your decision. Have a great day!
[2023-10-01T10:03:20] Fatima Al-Mansouri: You too, Nadia. Goodbye!", 'CreatedDate': '2023-10-01T10:00:00.000+0000'}]

VoiceCallTranscript__c

  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format

  - Id: ID of the task

input: Can we determine if this lead should be qualified based on their recent interactions? If not, which of these factors—Budget, Authority, Need, or Timeline—are hindering qualification? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output:
<execute> SELECT Body__c, CreatedDate, LeadId__c 
FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c 
WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000899xAMAQ' 
ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC </execute>

instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object

Lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.

input: Is this lead suitable for qualification based on their recent discussions? If not, is it due to 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline'? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Body__c, LeadId__c FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt0000089BywMAE' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC LIMIT 10 </execute>

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000898WPMAY
input: Considering the lead's recent discussions, is this lead deemed qualified? If not, which among 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' are the reasons for disqualification? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Id, Title, FAQ_Answer__c FROM Knowledge__kav WHERE Title LIKE '%BANT%' OR Title LIKE '%qualification%' OR FAQ_Answer__c LIKE '%BANT%' OR FAQ_Answer__c LIKE '%qualification%' </execute>
query_results: Salesforce instance output: []

- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.

- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
