instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task

Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event

  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)

UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object

Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead

input: Should this lead be considered qualified based on recent discussions? If not, identify whether 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' are the causes. Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').

[2023-10-05T10:00:04] Sophia Rodriguez: Hi, yes, this is she. Who am I speaking with?
[2023-10-05T10:00:08] Thato Mokoena: Hi Sophia, this is Thato Mokoena from ABC Solutions. How are you doing today?
[2023-10-05T10:00:12] Sophia Rodriguez: I'm doing well, thank you! And yourself?
[2023-10-05T10:00:18] Thato Mokoena: I'm great, thanks for asking. I'm calling to discuss your interest in our products and help determine your needs so we can provide the best solution for you. Do you have a few minutes to chat?
[2023-10-05T10:00:22] Sophia Rodriguez: Yes, absolutely. I was actually hoping to understand a bit more about what you offer.
[2023-10-05T10:00:28] Thato Mokoena: Fantastic. I see you're interested in our PCB EcoModel, PulseSim Pro, and SecuManage Pro. Could you tell me a bit about your specific requirements for these products?
[2023-10-05T10:00:40] Sophia Rodriguez: Sure. We're looking at the EcoModel and SecuManage for our new project installations. We need to ensure the installations are completed within three days. Time is of the essence for us.
[2023-10-05T10:00:50] Thato Mokoena: Absolutely, installing the PCB EcoModel is quick and efficient. It’s designed with an eco-friendly build that ensures minimal downtime and energy consumption, which should align well with your timeline.
[2023-10-05T10:00:58] Sophia Rodriguez: That sounds promising. How about the PulseSim Pro? That’s more of a specialized purchase.
[2023-10-05T10:01:10] Thato Mokoena: The PulseSim Pro is designed for high precision and reliability in simulation environments. It's intuitive to use, so your team can get started quickly without extensive training. Plus, it integrates seamlessly with the EcoModel.
[2023-10-05T10:01:18] Sophia Rodriguez: Integration is key for us. We're trying to streamline as much as possible.
[2023-10-05T10:01:28] Thato Mokoena: Exactly, and that’s one of the strong points of our solution—everything works synchronously to enhance performance. Now, considering your budget of $2,713, I want to ensure we stay within that framework while offering the best solution.
[2023-10-05T10:01:39] Sophia Rodriguez: Yes, budget management is definitely crucial for us. I don’t have the final say on budget approvals, though. I'll need to present this to the board.
[2023-10-05T10:01:48] Thato Mokoena: That's understandable, Sophia. We can also prepare a detailed proposal highlighting all the benefits and justifications, which could aid you when discussing with the board.
[2023-10-05T10:01:58] Sophia Rodriguez: That would be extremely helpful. We need to analyze the cost-benefit aspect to justify the investment.
[2023-10-05T10:02:05] Thato Mokoena: Exactly, and I am here to make sure you have everything you need for that approval. Should we proceed with preparing a custom plan? It would include pricing, timelines, and a detailed installation schedule.
[2023-10-05T10:02:12] Sophia Rodriguez: Yes, that sounds like a plan. Can you send this over by the end of the week?
[2023-10-05T10:02:18] Thato Mokoena: Certainly, I will have the proposal ready for you by then. Is there anything else you’d like to clarify about our products or services?
[2023-10-05T10:02:25] Sophia Rodriguez: Not at the moment, I think you've covered everything quite well. I appreciate your time and help on this.
[2023-10-05T10:02:32] Thato Mokoena: It was my pleasure, Sophia. I look forward to assisting you further and helping ensure your project's success. Have a great rest of your day!
[2023-10-05T10:02:36] Sophia Rodriguez: Thank you, Thato. You too!", 'CreatedDate': '2023-10-05T10:00:00.000+0000'}]

# Example 2

Case

Knowledge__kav

ProductCategory

Product2

QuoteLineItem

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.

input: Based on the recent discussions with the lead, is this lead qualified? If not, what are the reasons from 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline'? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Body__c FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000893dJMAQ' </execute>

Salesforce instance output: [{'Body__c': "[2023-10-24T10:00:00] Fatou Ndiaye: Good morning, Carlos! This is Fatou Ndiaye from EduTech Solutions. How are you doing today?
[2023-10-24T10:00:04] Carlos Gonzales: Good morning, Fatou. I'm doing well, thank you. How about yourself?
[2023-10-24T10:00:10] Fatou Ndiaye: I'm doing great, thanks for asking! I appreciate you taking the time to speak with me today. I wanted to discuss your interest in our EduTech Lab product. Is now still a good time to chat?
[2023-10-24T10:00:18] Carlos Gonzales: Yes, this is a perfect time. I’m really interested in learning more about the EduTech Lab.
[2023-10-24T10:00:25] Fatou Ndiaye: Wonderful! Let's dive right in. Just to confirm, you're looking at one unit of the EduTech Lab, correct?
[2023-10-24T10:00:30] Carlos Gonzales: That's right. We’re looking to enhance our teaching tools, and I believe this could be the right solution.
[2023-10-24T10:00:44] Fatou Ndiaye: Absolutely, EduTech Lab could be a great fit. It's designed to transform classroom environments with its interactive and responsive technology. May I ask, are you looking to integrate this within a specific curriculum, or is it more a general enhancement?
[2023-10-24T10:00:52] Carlos Gonzales: It's more of a general enhancement. We want to make our lessons more engaging for the students across different subjects.
[2023-10-24T10:01:10] Fatou Ndiaye: That makes sense. The EduTech Lab is versatile enough to be used across subjects like science, math, and even language arts. Plus, it comes with a suite of interactive modules that can be customized based on your needs. Are there any specific features you’re particularly interested in?
[2023-10-24T10:01:22] Carlos Gonzales: We’re interested in the interactive whiteboard feature and the virtual laboratory simulations.
[2023-10-24T10:01:40] Fatou Ndiaye: Both excellent features! The interactive whiteboard is a favorite among educators for its ease of use and the virtual lab simulations provide a dynamic learning experience without the logistics of setting up a physical lab. These are particularly useful for engaging students and bringing abstract concepts to life.
[2023-10-24T10:01:55] Carlos Gonzales: That sounds perfect for what we need. Could you tell me about the pricing?
[2023-10-24T10:02:09] Fatou Ndiaye: Of course! The pricing for one EduTech Lab unit is within your budget range of $466. This includes the hardware, software licenses for a year, and initial on-site training for your staff.
[2023-10-24T10:02:25] Carlos Gonzales: That's good to know. I should mention, I don't have the ultimate financial authority, but I can influence the decision. Would it be possible to get a more detailed proposal to share with my team?
[2023-10-24T10:02:40] Fatou Ndiaye: Absolutely, Carlos. I can put together a comprehensive proposal that outlines all the features and benefits, along with the installation process and training details. When would you like to have this by?
[2023-10-24T10:02:55] Carlos Gonzales: If possible, could you send it by the end of this week? Also, speaking of installation, we’re looking to install within one day. Is that feasible?
[2023-10-24T10:03:10] Fatou Ndiaye: Certainly, the end of the week works. And as for the installation, we have a team ready to ensure it's completed within a day, so you can start using it right away. Our technicians are very efficient, and they'll make sure it’s a smooth process.
[2023-10-24T10:03:20] Carlos Gonzales: Great to hear! I’m looking forward to reviewing the proposal with my team.
[2023-10-24T10:03:29] Fatou Ndiaye: Wonderful, Carlos. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss or any other questions you have at this stage?
[2023-10-24T10:03:34] Carlos Gonzales: Not at the moment, Fatou. I appreciate all the information you’ve provided.
[2023-10-24T10:03:44] Fatou Ndiaye: My pleasure! I’ll send that proposal over by the end of the week, and feel free to reach out if anything else comes up. Thank you for your time today, Carlos.
[2023-10-24T10:03:51] Carlos Gonzales: Thank you, Fatou. I’ll look forward to receiving the proposal. Have a great day!
[2023-10-24T10:03:55] Fatou Ndiaye: You too, Carlos! Goodbye."}]

Contract

VoiceCallTranscript__c

  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task

  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event

Territory2

UserTerritory2Association

  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object

instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object

[2023-11-01T10:00:08] Satoshi Tanaka: Hi Anwar, I'm doing well, thank you. How about you?

[2023-11-01T10:00:35] Anwar Malik: Wonderful. You've indicated an interest in purchasing two units. Can you share a bit more about what you're looking to achieve with DesignWave Automation?
[2023-11-01T10:00:51] Satoshi Tanaka: Certainly. We need to improve our production line efficiency, and from what I've read, DesignWave seems like it could streamline a lot of our processes.
[2023-11-01T10:01:05] Anwar Malik: Absolutely, Satoshi. DesignWave can automate repetitive tasks and optimize workflows, leading to faster production times. Will you be the one making the purchase decision, or is there a team involved?

[2023-11-01T10:01:30] Anwar Malik: That does make things easier. Our current budget options show that DesignWave Automation units are priced at $802 each. Your interest in two units falls just within your budget range of $804. How does that sound?

[2023-11-01T10:02:05] Anwar Malik: Yes, our team is quite experienced in quick installations, and for DesignWave, a one-day setup is definitely achievable. Just to confirm, that will cover installation and initial system tests.
[2023-11-01T10:02:15] Satoshi Tanaka: Great to hear that. And what about after-sales support?
[2023-11-01T10:02:27] Anwar Malik: We offer a comprehensive support package that includes 24/7 customer service, troubleshooting assistance, and free software updates for the first year.
[2023-11-01T10:02:36] Satoshi Tanaka: That sounds excellent. It gives me peace of mind knowing support is available if needed.
[2023-11-01T10:02:47] Anwar Malik: Exactly, our goal is to make your transition as smooth as possible. Is there anything else you'd like to know or discuss about the DesignWave products?
[2023-11-01T10:02:55] Satoshi Tanaka: Nothing comes to mind right now. I think you’ve covered most of it.
[2023-11-01T10:03:08] Anwar Malik: Alright, then, to sum up: you'll be purchasing two DesignWave Automation units, we'll proceed with the one-day installation, and you’ll have our support package. Does that sound good to proceed with?
[2023-11-01T10:03:14] Satoshi Tanaka: Yes, it does. Let’s go ahead with it.
[2023-11-01T10:03:25] Anwar Malik: Excellent. I'll send over the paperwork today and arrange for a team to begin installation tomorrow. Thank you, Satoshi. We're excited to work with you.
[2023-11-01T10:03:33] Satoshi Tanaka: Thanks, Anwar. I look forward to seeing the improvements in our production line.
[2023-11-01T10:03:38] Anwar Malik: You're welcome. Have a great day!
[2023-11-01T10:03:42] Satoshi Tanaka: You too.", 'CreatedDate': '2023-11-01T10:00:00.000+0000'}]

input: Should this lead be qualified based on their recent conversations? If not, identify if 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' are the reasons. Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').

  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)

Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object

VoiceCallTranscript__c

  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format

  - Id: ID of the lead

instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt0000089AJqMAM
input: Should this lead be qualified based on recent discussions? If not, which specific factors among 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' are responsible? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Id, LeadId__c, OpportunityId__c, Body__c, CreatedDate FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt0000089AJqMAM' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC </execute>

[2023-10-18T10:00:45] Miguel Torres: Perfect! Let's dive into it. For the EduTech Lab, it's a comprehensive educational kit that's ideal for both teaching and hands-on practice. You mentioned you need one of those?
[2023-10-18T10:01:00] Maria Fernandez: Exactly. We believe it will be a great addition to our training department.

[2023-10-18T10:01:25] Maria Fernandez: Yes. We have a small team working on prototyping projects and we need reliable tools for that.
[2023-10-18T10:01:40] Miguel Torres: Got it. The PCB QuickMaker is known for its accuracy and efficiency, which I think would really support your team’s productivity. And finally, the DevVision IDE – you’re thinking of four licenses?
[2023-10-18T10:01:55] Maria Fernandez: Correct. We’re expanding our development tools and have heard great things about its debugging and integration features.
[2023-10-18T10:02:10] Miguel Torres: Absolutely, it’s highly praised by other developers for those exact features. It’s a smart investment when working on complex projects.

[2023-10-18T10:02:55] Maria Fernandez: That would be amazing. We do have a timeline for installation. We need it all set up within 3 days.
[2023-10-18T10:03:15] Miguel Torres: Certainly. Our installation team is very efficient, and we can coordinate a schedule to meet your 3-day requirement. Just to clarify, you mentioned earlier that you would be coordinating with someone regarding the financial aspects?

[2023-10-18T10:04:55] Miguel Torres: You're welcome, Maria. Have a great day ahead, and talk to you soon!

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000899XJMAY
input: Can this lead be qualified based on their recent conversations? If not, is it due to 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline'? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Id, Body__c, CreatedDate, LeadId__c, OpportunityId__c FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000899XJMAY' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC </execute>
