instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000893OjMAI
input: From the lead's recent discussions, can this lead be considered qualified? If not, is it due to 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline'? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Id, Body__c, LeadId__c FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000893OjMAI' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC LIMIT 10 </execute>

[2023-10-21T10:00:05] Aisha Patel: Hi Mei, this is Aisha speaking.

[2023-10-21T10:00:18] Aisha Patel: No problem, Mei. My day's going well, just busy as always. How about you?
[2023-10-21T10:00:24] Mei Lin: I'm doing well, thanks for asking! I wanted to chat with you about the products you've shown interest in—VerifySim Elite, FlexiDesign Pro, and SecuManage Pro. Do you have a few minutes to discuss these?
[2023-10-21T10:00:35] Aisha Patel: Sure, that sounds good. I'm curious to know more about them.
[2023-10-21T10:00:45] Mei Lin: Great! Let’s start with VerifySim Elite. It's a simulation software that’s perfect for creating detailed virtual environments. Many of our clients use it for training and testing purposes. Does this sound like something that could benefit your operations?
[2023-10-21T10:01:00] Aisha Patel: It sounds interesting, but honestly, I’m not sure if we have a specific need for it at the moment. We were just exploring options.
[2023-10-21T10:01:15] Mei Lin: Understood. It's important to find the right fit. VerifySim Elite could be a tool to enhance your team’s efficiency, but let’s move on to FlexiDesign Pro. You mentioned you were interested in four licenses. Is there a particular project you’re considering it for?

[2023-10-21T10:01:45] Mei Lin: FlexiDesign Pro is ideal for that. It offers a rich set of features for visual and spatial design, collaboration tools, and much more. Plus, it can integrate smoothly with most of your existing tools, which should help in speeding up your projects.
[2023-10-21T10:02:00] Aisha Patel: That’s good to know. And what about SecuManage Pro? We’re looking into security management solutions as well.
[2023-10-21T10:02:15] Mei Lin: SecuManage Pro is great for comprehensive security management. It provides real-time monitoring and threat detection across multiple devices, which helps in maintaining the integrity of your data and systems. Would enhanced security be a priority for your team?
[2023-10-21T10:02:28] Aisha Patel: Yes, security is always a top priority for us. It sounds like what we need.
[2023-10-21T10:02:38] Mei Lin: That's excellent. Based on your interest, if you were to proceed with one VerifySim Elite license, four FlexiDesign Pro licenses, and two SecuManage Pro licenses, your approximate investment would be $3,660. Does this align with your budget?
[2023-10-21T10:02:50] Aisha Patel: Yes, that's within our budget. How soon could we get everything installed?
[2023-10-21T10:03:00] Mei Lin: We can definitely work with that budget. As for the installation timeline, we can coordinate to complete everything within four days after the purchase is confirmed. Does that timeline suit you?
[2023-10-21T10:03:15] Aisha Patel: That works for us. I just need to review some more details before moving forward. Can you send me an email with all the information we discussed today?
[2023-10-21T10:03:25] Mei Lin: Absolutely, Aisha. I’ll send over a detailed email with all the product specs, pricing, and the installation process right after our call. Feel free to reach out if you have any questions.
[2023-10-21T10:03:35] Aisha Patel: Thank you, Mei. I’ll keep an eye on my inbox. I appreciate your time today.
[2023-10-21T10:03:42] Mei Lin: My pleasure, Aisha. Thank you for considering our solutions. Have a great day!
[2023-10-21T10:03:45] Aisha Patel: You too, Mei. Goodbye!", 'LeadId__c': '00QWt00000893OjMAI'}]

input: Should this lead be qualified based on their recent discussions? If not, identify whether 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' are contributing factors. Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Id, LeadId__c, Body__c, CreatedDate FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000898rWMAQ' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC </execute>

[2023-10-12T10:00:05] Kai Takahashi: Yes, this is Kai. Who am I speaking with?
[2023-10-12T10:00:10] Felix Jørgensen: Hi Kai, this is Felix Jørgensen from SmartTech Innovations. How are you today?
[2023-10-12T10:00:15] Kai Takahashi: I'm doing well, Felix. Thanks for asking. How about you?
[2023-10-12T10:00:22] Felix Jørgensen: I'm great, thank you! The weather's finally cooling down here, so that's nice. Anyway, I understand you’re interested in some of our products, and I wanted to discuss your needs to see how we can best support you.
[2023-10-12T10:00:35] Kai Takahashi: Yes, that's right. I’ve been looking at the CloudInnovate Space, AutoLayout Master, and CryptGuard Module. I believe they could be very beneficial for our operations.
[2023-10-12T10:00:45] Felix Jørgensen: Fantastic choices! Just to confirm, you're interested in one CloudInnovate Space, and three each of the AutoLayout Master and CryptGuard Module, correct?
[2023-10-12T10:00:51] Kai Takahashi: Yes, that's the plan.
[2023-10-12T10:00:57] Felix Jørgensen: Great, Kai. Can I ask, what specific needs do you have that you believe these products can fulfill?
[2023-10-12T10:01:10] Kai Takahashi: Well, we're looking to upgrade our security and enhance our project management capabilities. The CryptGuard Module seems to have excellent security features, and the AutoLayout Master appears to be very user-friendly for design tasks.
[2023-10-12T10:01:26] Felix Jørgensen: Absolutely, you've hit the nail on the head. The CryptGuard Module offers top-tier encryption and security protocols, perfect for protecting sensitive data. The AutoLayout Master is also designed to streamline design processes, saving both time and resources.
[2023-10-12T10:01:41] Kai Takahashi: That sounds ideal. I do have a timeline concern though. We’re looking to have everything up and running within four days. Is that feasible?
[2023-10-12T10:01:52] Felix Jørgensen: Certainly, we can accommodate that timeline. We have an efficient team that handles installations speedily and professionally. We can prioritize your installation to meet your deadline.
[2023-10-12T10:02:05] Kai Takahashi: Great to hear. And about the cost, could you provide some clarity on that aspect? I have a budget of 3875.
[2023-10-12T10:02:22] Felix Jørgensen: Sure. Let me break it down for you. The CloudInnovate Space is 1500, each AutoLayout Master is 600, and each CryptGuard Module is 450. So, in total, you'd be looking at 3750, which fits comfortably within your budget.
[2023-10-12T10:02:33] Kai Takahashi: That's perfect, Felix. I appreciate the detailed breakdown.
[2023-10-12T10:02:42] Felix Jørgensen: My pleasure, Kai. Since you have the financial authority, should we proceed with securing your order today?
[2023-10-12T10:02:49] Kai Takahashi: Yes, I’m ready to move forward. Let’s get this started.
[2023-10-12T10:02:59] Felix Jørgensen: Fantastic! I’ll send over the contract and the payment details immediately after our call. We’ll schedule the installation right away to ensure we meet your timeline.
[2023-10-12T10:03:07] Kai Takahashi: Sounds good, Felix. Thank you for your help and clear information.
[2023-10-12T10:03:16] Felix Jørgensen: You're welcome, Kai. Thank you for choosing SmartTech Innovations. If you have any further questions, feel free to reach out. Have a great day!
[2023-10-12T10:03:20] Kai Takahashi: Will do. Thank you, bye!
[2023-10-12T10:03:23] Felix Jørgensen: Goodbye, Kai!", 'CreatedDate': '2023-10-12T10:00:00.000+0000'}]

- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000898jOMAQ

instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000897TwMAI
input: From the recent interactions, is the lead ready to be qualified? If not, which factor among 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' is the cause? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Id, Body__c, LeadId__c, OpportunityId__c FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000897TwMAI' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC LIMIT 1 </execute>

- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.

  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000892pCMAQ
input: Should this lead be qualified based on recent discussions? If not, which among 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' is the reason? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Id, Body__c, CreatedDate, LeadId__c FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000892pCMAQ' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC LIMIT 5 </execute>

instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt000008981uMAA
input: Should this lead be considered qualified based on their recent discussions? If not, which factor among 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' is the reason? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').

[2023-10-16T10:00:50] Nguyen Thi Minh: Great. Let me give you a quick overview. Starting with DevVision IDE, it’s our integrated development environment that enhances coding efficiency and collaboration. It also offers powerful debugging tools. Is that something that would benefit your team?

[2023-10-16T10:02:00] Nguyen Thi Minh: Perfect. As for the CollabCircuit Hub, it’s excellent for enhancing team connectivity, especially if you have remote workers. It improves project management and facilitates communication. Do you currently face challenges in these areas?
[2023-10-16T10:02:15] Kim Seung-woo: We do have some communication issues, especially with remote staff. That’s why I’m looking into this product.
[2023-10-16T10:02:30] Nguyen Thi Minh: CollabCircuit Hub can definitely help with that. It integrates seamlessly with existing tools and improves workflow communication significantly.
[2023-10-16T10:02:45] Kim Seung-woo: Great to know. What about the pricing? I have a budget of around $2979, and I need to ensure everything fits into this.

Do the features or package options interest you more that I could tailor around your budget?

[2023-10-16T10:03:45] Nguyen Thi Minh: That’s perfectly fine. Just a quick note on the CloudLink Designer—it's a versatile tool for managing cloud-based projects, should you need enhanced cloud operations. But scaling sounds like a smart starting point.
[2023-10-16T10:04:05] Kim Seung-woo: I’ll keep that in mind. Alright. How soon can we proceed with the installation? I need it set up within three days.
[2023-10-16T10:04:20] Nguyen Thi Minh: We can definitely accommodate that timeline. Once everything is aligned and approved on your end, our team can start the installation within those three days. We pride ourselves on a smooth process.
[2023-10-16T10:04:38] Kim Seung-woo: Okay, that reinforces my confidence. I’ll need one more meeting to get everything approved internally, but I am the final decision maker here.
[2023-10-16T10:04:52] Nguyen Thi Minh: I appreciate you letting me know, Mr. Kim. We’ll be ready when you are. Feel free to reach out with any other questions. Would it help if I emailed you a detailed proposal to review with your team?
[2023-10-16T10:05:05] Kim Seung-woo: Yes, that would be very helpful. Send it over to my email, and I’ll take it from there.
[2023-10-16T10:05:15] Nguyen Thi Minh: Will do. Expect it in your inbox shortly. Thank you for your time today, and I look forward to hearing back soon.
[2023-10-16T10:05:22] Kim Seung-woo: Thank you, Minh. Speak to you soon.
[2023-10-16T10:05:27] Nguyen Thi Minh: Goodbye, Mr. Kim.", 'CreatedDate': '2023-10-16T10:00:01.000+0000'}]

        ## Lead qualification guide.

input: Is this lead qualified based on recent discussions? If not, which among 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' are the reasons? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output:
<execute> SELECT Body__c, CreatedDate 
FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c 
WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000899QuMAI' 
ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC </execute>

Salesforce instance output: [{'Body__c': "[2023-10-10T10:00:00] Maria Papadopoulos: Hello, this is Maria Papadopoulos from Tech Innovations. Am I speaking with Alberto Gomez?
[2023-10-10T10:00:07] Alberto Gomez: Hi Maria, yes, this is Alberto. How are you doing today?
[2023-10-10T10:00:12] Maria Papadopoulos: I'm doing well, thank you! How about you?
[2023-10-10T10:00:16] Alberto Gomez: I'm good, thanks. Just busy with the usual things.
[2023-10-10T10:00:22] Maria Papadopoulos: I understand, I'll try to keep this brief. I see you're interested in our AutoLayout Master product, is that right?
[2023-10-10T10:00:26] Alberto Gomez: That's correct. I'm looking at getting two units.
[2023-10-10T10:00:35] Maria Papadopoulos: Great! The AutoLayout Master is really popular because of its intuitive design and ability to streamline layout projects. Can I ask what specific needs you're looking to address with it?
[2023-10-10T10:00:51] Alberto Gomez: We have several ongoing projects, and efficiency is key. We need something that can help us cut down on the layout time while maintaining precision.
[2023-10-10T10:01:04] Maria Papadopoulos: That makes sense. The AutoLayout Master is perfect for that. It's equipped with advanced algorithms that can reduce layout time by up to 30%. Plus, it's super easy to integrate into your current systems.
[2023-10-10T10:01:13] Alberto Gomez: That sounds promising. What's the cost for two units?
[2023-10-10T10:01:22] Maria Papadopoulos: Each unit is priced at $522, so for two units, it would be $1,044. Would this fit within your budget?
[2023-10-10T10:01:30] Alberto Gomez: Yes, that's right at our limit, but it works.
[2023-10-10T10:01:35] Maria Papadopoulos: Fantastic. I do need to ask, how soon are you looking to have these installed?
[2023-10-10T10:01:40] Alberto Gomez: As soon as possible, ideally within a day if that's achievable.
[2023-10-10T10:01:51] Maria Papadopoulos: We can definitely prioritize your installation and get it done within a day. Just a quick note, is there anyone else involved in the approval process for this purchase?
[2023-10-10T10:02:02] Alberto Gomez: I'll need to run it by our finance manager. I handle the technical needs, but she signs off on purchases.
[2023-10-10T10:02:11] Maria Papadopoulos: Got it. I'd be happy to provide any additional information she might need to make the decision easier. Also, would you like me to send over a detailed proposal for her review?
[2023-10-10T10:02:19] Alberto Gomez: Yes, that would be great. Please include all the details so she can go through it thoroughly.
[2023-10-10T10:02:26] Maria Papadopoulos: Absolutely, I'll send over a detailed proposal right after our call, including installation timelines and support options.
[2023-10-10T10:02:35] Alberto Gomez: Perfect. Thanks, Maria. I appreciate all the help.
[2023-10-10T10:02:41] Maria Papadopoulos: You're welcome, Alberto. If you have any questions later, feel free to reach out. Have a great day!
[2023-10-10T10:02:45] Alberto Gomez: You too, Maria. Talk to you soon.", 'CreatedDate': '2023-10-10T10:00:00.000+0000'}]

You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000892Z9MAI
input: Does the lead's recent discussions indicate they should be qualified? If not, which among 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' is the cause? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Body__c FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000892Z9MAI' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC LIMIT 1 </execute>
