instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000897YjMAI
input: From the recent discussions with the lead, should this lead be considered qualified? If not, which among 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' are the reasons for disqualification? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output:
<execute> SELECT Id, Body__c, LeadId__c, OpportunityId__c 
FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c 
WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000897YjMAI' 
ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC 
LIMIT 10 </execute>

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.

        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000897aRMAQ
input: Considering the lead's recent discussions, should this lead be deemed qualified? If not, is it due to 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline'? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Id, Body__c, LeadId__c, CreatedDate FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000897aRMAQ' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC </execute>

Salesforce instance output: [{'Id': 'a05Wt000003SrSvIAK', 'Body__c': "[2023-10-05T10:01:00] Linh Tran: Hi Carlos, this is Linh Tran from TechAdvance. How are you today?
[2023-10-05T10:01:05] Carlos Ramirez: Hi Linh! I’m doing well, thanks. It's a busy week though! How about you?
[2023-10-05T10:01:18] Linh Tran: I'm good, thank you! I can imagine. Let's make this as efficient as possible for you. I understand you're interested in our VerifySim Elite, AI Cirku-Tech, and SimulateX Edge solutions?
[2023-10-05T10:01:28] Carlos Ramirez: Yes, that's correct. I'm looking into getting 2 units of the VerifySim Elite, 4 of the AI Cirku-Tech, and 2 of the SimulateX Edge.
[2023-10-05T10:01:45] Linh Tran: Excellent choice! Those products work really well together, especially in streamlining operational efficiency. Could you share a bit about what you're hoping to achieve with them?
[2023-10-05T10:01:58] Carlos Ramirez: Sure. We need to enhance our simulation capabilities to support our upcoming projects and improve our robustness in data integration.
[2023-10-05T10:02:16] Linh Tran: The VerifySim Elite is perfect for strengthening simulation capabilities. It offers advanced analytics and is tailored for high-volume processing. Meanwhile, the AI Cirku-Tech excels in managing data flow, ensuring smooth integration processes.
[2023-10-05T10:02:28] Carlos Ramirez: That sounds great. How does the SimulateX Edge fit into that?
[2023-10-05T10:02:42] Linh Tran: SimulateX Edge enhances edge computing power, which is critical for real-time data analysis and decision-making. Together, they'll give you a comprehensive simulation ecosystem.
[2023-10-05T10:03:00] Carlos Ramirez: Sounds ideal. What about the cost? Our budget is around 3750.
[2023-10-05T10:03:20] Linh Tran: I understand. The package for your specifications would typically exceed that budget slightly, but we can discuss potential discounts or financing options to meet your financial needs.
[2023-10-05T10:03:35] Carlos Ramirez: That would be helpful. How quickly can we have these installed? We're hoping to have everything up within 4 days.
[2023-10-05T10:03:50] Linh Tran: We can definitely accommodate that timeline. Our team will prioritize your setup given the clear synergy with your operation and tight schedule.
[2023-10-05T10:04:05] Carlos Ramirez: Perfect. I'm also the primary decision-maker on this, so I'm ready to move forward if everything aligns.
[2023-10-05T10:04:20] Linh Tran: Great to hear, Carlos. Let's go over the specifics on pricing and installation scheduling to firm this up and ensure we stay within your budget.
[2023-10-05T10:04:35] Carlos Ramirez: Yes, let's do that. I'll want to review everything before finalizing but I'm optimistic. Thanks for your help, Linh.
[2023-10-05T10:04:45] Linh Tran: My pleasure, Carlos. I'll send over detailed pricing and timeline proposals shortly. Looking forward to working together to meet your needs.
[2023-10-05T10:04:55] Carlos Ramirez: Thank you. I'll keep an eye out for that email. Have a great day!
[2023-10-05T10:05:00] Linh Tran: You too, Carlos. Talk soon!", 'LeadId__c': '00QWt00000897aRMAQ', 'CreatedDate': '2023-10-05T10:01:00.000+0000'}]

- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action

  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract

VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript

  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event

  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event

  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000893dMMAQ

instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000899AoMAI
input: Should this lead be qualified based on the recent discussions? If not, which factor among 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline' is causing disqualification? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Id, LeadId__c, Body__c, CreatedDate FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000899AoMAI' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC </execute>

[2023-10-12T10:00:07] Isabella Martini: Yes, this is Isabella. How may I assist you today?
[2023-10-12T10:00:15] Thato Mokoena: Hi, Isabella! I hope you're having a good day. I'm calling to discuss your interest in our products and see how we can help address your needs.
[2023-10-12T10:00:25] Isabella Martini: Thank you, Thato. Yes, I've been looking into a few of your products and I'm curious to learn more, especially the OptiEnergy Suite.
[2023-10-12T10:00:35] Thato Mokoena: Great to hear that. The OptiEnergy Suite is one of our most popular products. It's designed to optimize energy use comprehensively. What are you hoping to achieve with it?
[2023-10-12T10:00:46] Isabella Martini: We aim to improve energy efficiency across our operations and reduce costs. We're also on a tight timeline and hope to implement solutions quickly.
[2023-10-12T10:01:00] Thato Mokoena: Understood. The OptiEnergy Suite does exactly that—streamlines energy management which can result in substantial cost savings. You mentioned a tight timeline. Can you elaborate on that?
[2023-10-12T10:01:09] Isabella Martini: Ideally, we would like to finish the installation in about four days if possible.
[2023-10-12T10:01:21] Thato Mokoena: We can definitely work towards that. We have an experienced team capable of quick installations. Besides the OptiEnergy Suite, you showed interest in AutoGen IDE and VerifySim Elite. Are there specific features you need from these products?
[2023-10-12T10:01:38] Isabella Martini: Yes, the AutoGen IDE is intriguing for its automated development capabilities, and VerifySim Elite seems perfect for our simulation needs. But I'm a bit concerned about staying within budget.
[2023-10-12T10:01:52] Thato Mokoena: I appreciate your concern. You’re considering 4 OptiEnergy Suites, 1 AutoGen IDE, and 2 VerifySim Elites, correct?
[2023-10-12T10:01:57] Isabella Martini: That's right.
[2023-10-12T10:02:10] Thato Mokoena: For your budget of 4017, our finance team can work on customizable packages that might fit your needs. Since you do not have ultimate financial authority, is there someone else who makes the final purchase decision?
[2023-10-12T10:02:22] Isabella Martini: Yes, I’ll need to present this to our COO, who will make the final call. I'll need detailed insights to justify the expenditure.
[2023-10-12T10:02:35] Thato Mokoena: We can definitely provide you with a detailed proposal outlining cost benefits and ROI. This will help you convey the value to your COO. How does that sound?
[2023-10-12T10:02:44] Isabella Martini: That would be perfect. Could you include deployment timelines and any support options you offer?
[2023-10-12T10:02:56] Thato Mokoena: Of course. I'll send those details. Our support team is available 24/7, ensuring that any issues you encounter are swiftly addressed. Do you have other questions or concerns at this stage?
[2023-10-12T10:03:03] Isabella Martini: Not at the moment. I'll wait for your proposal.
[2023-10-12T10:03:15] Thato Mokoena: Perfect. Expect the proposal by tomorrow. Thank you for your time, Isabella. Please feel free to reach out to me anytime. Have a great day!
[2023-10-12T10:03:22] Isabella Martini: Thank you, Thato. I’ll talk to you soon. Goodbye!", 'CreatedDate': '2023-10-12T10:00:01.000+0000'}]

input: Should this lead be qualified based on recent discussions? If it's not, what are the reasons among 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline'? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Body__c, LeadId__c FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt000008981tMAA' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC </execute>
query_results:
Salesforce instance output: [{'Body__c': "[2023-10-17T10:00:05] Sophia Müller: Good morning, this is Sophia Müller from EcoTech Solutions. Am I speaking with Tariq Al-Mohammed?
[2023-10-17T10:00:10] Tariq Al-Mohammed: Yes, this is Tariq. How can I assist you today?
[2023-10-17T10:00:20] Sophia Müller: Thank you for taking my call, Tariq. I'm reaching out because I understand you're interested in our EcoPower Convert and PulseSim Pro products. Is that correct?
[2023-10-17T10:00:30] Tariq Al-Mohammed: Yes, that's right. I've been looking into these products, and they seem like they could be a good fit for our needs.
[2023-10-17T10:00:40] Sophia Müller: Great to hear! To better understand how we can assist you, could you tell me a bit more about your specific needs?
[2023-10-17T10:00:55] Tariq Al-Mohammed: Sure, we’re looking for something that offers reliable performance with energy efficiency, especially as we transition to more sustainable operations.
[2023-10-17T10:01:10] Sophia Müller: The EcoPower Convert is excellent for optimizing energy consumption while maintaining high performance levels. Its advanced conversion technology ensures minimal energy loss. Do you find energy efficiency a primary priority?
[2023-10-17T10:01:25] Tariq Al-Mohammed: Definitely. Energy efficiency is crucial for us. Could you also give me a brief overview of the PulseSim Pro?
[2023-10-17T10:01:40] Sophia Müller: Certainly! The PulseSim Pro offers real-time data analysis and simulation capabilities. It's particularly beneficial for monitoring and optimizing system functions continuously.
[2023-10-17T10:01:55] Tariq Al-Mohammed: That sounds promising. How do they integrate? Are they compatible when used together?
[2023-10-17T10:02:10] Sophia Müller: Great question! These products are designed to be highly compatible, providing seamless data integration for improved operational efficiency. Would that align with your requirements?
[2023-10-17T10:02:25] Tariq Al-Mohammed: Yes, that sounds ideal. Though, I do need to keep within a budget. We’re aiming to keep our spending at around $890.
[2023-10-17T10:02:40] Sophia Müller: Understood. The combined cost for the EcoPower Convert and PulseSim Pro fits well within your budget. Also, they come with a comprehensive support package.
[2023-10-17T10:02:55] Tariq Al-Mohammed: That's reassuring. My main concern is the installation. We prefer to have this done within a day. Is that feasible?
[2023-10-17T10:03:10] Sophia Müller: Absolutely, we can accommodate a 1-day installation timeline. Our team is quite experienced with fast, efficient installations without compromising quality.
[2023-10-17T10:03:25] Tariq Al-Mohammed: Sounds perfect. I do need to run this decision by my superior since I don’t have the ultimate authority on purchases. How should we proceed in that case?
[2023-10-17T10:03:40] Sophia Müller: No problem, Tariq. I can send you a detailed proposal and product documentation that you can review with your team. Would that be helpful?
[2023-10-17T10:03:50] Tariq Al-Mohammed: Yes, that would be great. Please send the materials to my email, so I can present them in our next meeting.
[2023-10-17T10:04:00] Sophia Müller: Sure, I’ll make sure to include all the relevant details. Would you like to schedule a follow-up call after your meeting?
[2023-10-17T10:04:10] Tariq Al-Mohammed: That would be helpful. Let’s set up a call for early next week.
[2023-10-17T10:04:20] Sophia Müller: Perfect. I’ll send over an email to confirm our follow-up call. Thank you for your time today, Tariq. Looking forward to continuing our discussion.
[2023-10-17T10:04:25] Tariq Al-Mohammed: Thank you, Sophia. Have a great day!
[2023-10-17T10:04:30] Sophia Müller: You too, Tariq. Goodbye!", 'LeadId__c': '00QWt000008981tMAA'}]

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

Event

Territory2

UserTerritory2Association

Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object

  - Id: ID of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2
Question: Look for the name Joe Smith in the name field of a lead and return the name and phone number.
Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

# Salesforce instance description
The objects available in the Salesforce instance are:
User, Account, Contact, Case, Knowledge__kav, ProductCategory, Product2, ProductCategoryProduct, Pricebook2, PricebookEntry, Order, OrderItem, EmailMessage, LiveChatTranscript, Issue__c, CaseHistory__c, Opportunity, OpportunityLineItem, Quote, QuoteLineItem, Contract, VoiceCallTranscript__c, Task, Event, Territory2, UserTerritory2Association, Lead

## The fields available for the objects along with their descriptions and dependencies are:
User
  - Alias: Alias, usually a shortened version of the agent's name
  - Email: Email address of the agent
  - EmailEncodingKey: Email encoding, usually 'UTF-8'
  - FirstName: First name of the agent
  - Id: ID of the user
  - LanguageLocaleKey: Language locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - LastName: Last name of the agent
  - LocaleSidKey: Locale, e.g., 'en_US'
  - Phone: Phone number of the agent
  - ProfileId: ID of the user profile, typically 'Standard User' or a similar profile
  - TimeZoneSidKey: Time zone, e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'
  - Username: Unique username for the agent in Salesforce
Account
  - Description: Detailed description of the account
  - Id: ID of the account
  - Industry: Industry the account belongs to
  - Name: Name of the account
  - NumberOfEmployees: Number of employees in the account
  - Phone: Phone number of the account
  - ShippingState: State for shipping address
Contact
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - Email: Email address of the contact
  - FirstName: First name of the contact
  - Id: ID of the contact
  - LastName: Last name of the contact
Case
  - AccountId: References Account object
  - ClosedDate: Date when the case was closed in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this case. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the case was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the case
  - Id: ID of the case
  - IssueId__c: ID of the Issue associated with this case
  - OrderItemId__c: ID of the Order Item associated with this case
  - OwnerId: The latest owner of the case. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the case
  - Status: Status of the case, e.g., 'New', 'Working', 'Escalated', etc
  - Subject: Subject of the case
Knowledge__kav
  - FAQ_Answer__c: Content of the knowledge article
  - Id: ID of the knowledge article
  - Summary: Summary of the article
  - Title: Title of the knowledge article
  - UrlName: Unique URL for the article
ProductCategory
  - CatalogId: ID of the catalog this category belongs to
  - Id: ID of the product category
  - Name: Name of the product category
Product2
  - Description: Description of the product
  - External_ID__c: External ID for mapping purposes
  - Id: ID of the product
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the product is active
  - Name: Name of the product
ProductCategoryProduct
  - Id: ID of the product category product
  - ProductCategoryId: References ProductCategory object
  - ProductId: References Product2 object
Pricebook2
  - Description: Description of the price book
  - Id: ID of the price book
  - IsActive: Boolean to mark if the price book is active
  - Name: Name of the price book
  - ValidFrom: Start date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ValidTo: End date for the price book in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
PricebookEntry
  - Id: ID of the price book entry
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this entry belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this price book entry. References Product2 object
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Order
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - EffectiveDate: Effective date of the order in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Id: ID of the order
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the order. References User object
  - Pricebook2Id: ID of the price book this order belongs to. References Pricebook2 object
  - Status: Status of the order, typically 'Draft' or 'Activated'
OrderItem
  - Id: ID of the order item
  - OrderId: ID of the order this item belongs to. References Order object
  - PriceBookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this order item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this order item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
EmailMessage
  - FromAddress: Sender email address
  - Id: ID of the email message
  - MessageDate: Timestamp when the message was sent in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - ParentId: ID of the case related to this email. References Case object
  - RelatedToId: ID that links to objects like Opportunity and Case. Identical to ParentId when associated with a case. References Case and Opportunity objects.
  - Subject: Subject of the email
  - TextBody: Content of the email
  - ToIds: List of recipient IDs
LiveChatTranscript
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Body: Content of the chat transcript
  - CaseId: ID of the case related to this chat. References Case object
  - ContactId: References Contact object
  - EndTime: Timestamp when the chat ended
  - Id: ID of the live chat transcript
  - LiveChatVisitorId: ID of the chat visitor
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owned the chat. References User object
Issue__c
  - Description__c: Detailed description of the issue
  - Id: ID of the issue
  - Name: The name/title of the issue
CaseHistory__c
  - CaseId__c: ID of the case this history entry is related to. References Case object
  - CreatedDate: The date when this change was made, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Field__c: Specifies the field or type of change. One of ['Case Creation', 'Owner Assignment', 'Case Closed']
  - Id: ID of the case history
  - NewValue__c: The new value after the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
  - OldValue__c: The previous value before the change. References User object if the type of change is 'Owner Assignment' else null
Opportunity
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - Amount: Monetary value of the opportunity in the default currency
  - CloseDate: Expected close date of the opportunity
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this opportunity. References Contact object
  - ContractID__c: ID of the contract associated with this opportunity. References Contract object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the opportunity was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the opportunity
  - Id: ID of the opportunity
  - Name: Name of the opportunity
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the opportunity. References User object
  - Probability: Probability of winning the opportunity
  - StageName: Stage of the opportunity. One of ['Qualification', 'Discovery', 'Quote', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
OpportunityLineItem
  - Id: ID of the opportunity line item
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this line item. References Opportunity object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
Quote
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - ContactId: ID of the contact associated with this quote. References Contact object
  - CreatedDate: Date when the quote was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the quote
  - ExpirationDate: Expiration date of the quote, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the quote
  - Name: Name of the quote
  - OpportunityId: ID of the opportunity associated with this quote. References Opportunity object
  - Status: Status of the quote. One of ['Draft', 'Needs Review', 'In Review', 'Approved', 'Rejected', 'Presented', 'Accepted', 'Denied']
QuoteLineItem
  - Discount: Discount applied to the product
  - Id: ID of the quote line item
  - OpportunityLineItemId: ID of the opportunity line item associated with this quote line item. References OpportunityLineItem object
  - PricebookEntryId: ID of the price book entry for this line item. References PricebookEntry object
  - Product2Id: ID of the product associated with this line item. References Product2 object
  - Quantity: Quantity of the product ordered
  - QuoteId: ID of the quote associated with this line item. References Quote object
  - TotalPrice: Total price of the product. Calculated as Quantity * UnitPrice * (1 - Discount/100)
  - UnitPrice: Unit price of the product
Contract
  - AccountId: ID of the customer account. References Account object
  - CompanySignedDate: Date when the company signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - ContractTerm: Duration of the contract in months
  - CustomerSignedDate: Date when the customer signed the contract, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the contract terms and conditions
  - Id: ID of the contract
  - StartDate: Date when the contract becomes effective, in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - Status: Status of the contract. One of ['In approval Process', 'Activated', 'Draft', 'Rejected', 'Negotiating', 'Awaiting Signature', 'Signature Declined', 'Signed', 'Canceled', 'Contract Terminated']
VoiceCallTranscript__c
  - Body__c: Content of the voice call transcript
  - CreatedDate: Date when the voice call transcript was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - EndTime__c: Timestamp when the voice call transcript ended, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the task. References User object
  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event
  - DurationInMinutes: Duration of the event in minutes
  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the event. References User object
  - StartDateTime: Start datetime of the event, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead
  - FirstName: First name of the lead
  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead
  - OwnerId: ID of the agent who owns the lead. References User object
  - Phone: Phone number of the lead
  - Status: Status of the lead. One of ['New', 'Contacted', 'Qualified', 'Proposal', 'Negotiation', 'Closed']
  - Title: Job title of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata

        ## Lead qualification guide.
        Look for the voice call transcripts with the lead and relevant knowledge articles to justify the lead qualification.
        
        - Lead Id to be considered is: 00QWt00000897k1MAA
input: Is this lead qualified based on their recent conversations? If not, which of the following factors contribute to their disqualification: 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline'? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Body__c, CreatedDate FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000897k1MAA' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC </execute>

[2023-10-05T10:02:40] Alice Smith: Thanks, you too. Goodbye!", 'CreatedDate': '2023-10-05T10:00:00.000+0000'}]

Output:
<execute> FIND {Joe Smith} IN NAME FIELDS RETURNING Lead(Name, Phone) </execute>
    (If the observation from the Salesforce instance is [{Joe Smith, 1234567890}], your next step can be)
<respond> Joe Smith, 1234567890 </respond> OR <respond> The name is Joe Smith and the phone number is 1234567890 </respond>

input: Based on the lead's latest discussions, should this lead be considered qualified? If not, which of the following reasons apply: 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', or 'Timeline'? Return only one or several of the four BANT factors that the lead qualification fails to meet (i.e. 'Budget', 'Authority', 'Need', 'Timeline').
output: <execute> SELECT Body__c, CreatedDate FROM VoiceCallTranscript__c WHERE LeadId__c = '00QWt00000893q9MAA' ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC LIMIT 1 </execute>

[2023-11-01T10:02:20] Fatou Bamba: Hi Adebola! I'm doing well, thank you. How about you?
[2023-11-01T10:02:35] Adebola Adeyemi: I'm great, thank you! I appreciate you taking the time to speak with me. I understand you're interested in some of our products, and I wanted to discuss them with you to see how they might fit your needs.
[2023-11-01T10:02:50] Fatou Bamba: Sure, I looked at a few options online. I'm curious about VeriSim Express, SecureData Nexus, and AutoGen IDE.
[2023-11-01T10:03:05] Adebola Adeyemi: Great choices! These products offer a range of capabilities. Could you share a bit about what you're hoping to achieve with these solutions?
[2023-11-01T10:03:20] Fatou Bamba: Honestly, I'm not completely sure how they'll fit in yet. I just heard good things and thought I should explore them.
[2023-11-01T10:03:35] Adebola Adeyemi: That's perfectly fine. Let me give you a brief overview of each product. VeriSim Express is excellent for simulation-based testing, which enhances efficiency and accuracy in complicated scenarios.
[2023-11-01T10:03:50] Adebola Adeyemi: SecureData Nexus, on the other hand, is geared towards data protection, ensuring your critical information is secure and easily manageable across different platforms.
[2023-11-01T10:04:05] Adebola Adeyemi: And then there's AutoGen IDE, a fantastic tool for streamlining the development process with automation, significantly cutting down your project timelines.
[2023-11-01T10:04:20] Fatou Bamba: I see. And how do the pricing and installation work?
[2023-11-01T10:04:35] Adebola Adeyemi: For pricing, the VeriSim Express is priced at $900, SecureData Nexus at $600 each, and AutoGen IDE at $450 each. So, for one VeriSim, two SecureData Nexus, and four AutoGen IDE, your total would be within your budget of $3719.
[2023-11-01T10:04:50] Fatou Bamba: Sounds good, and what about the installation?
[2023-11-01T10:05:05] Adebola Adeyemi: We can definitely meet your timeline to have these installed within three days upon purchase. We have a dedicated installation team that ensures a smooth and quick setup.
[2023-11-01T10:05:20] Fatou Bamba: Perfect. I do have the authority to make these decisions, but I want to make sure I'm not missing anything crucial before making a purchase.
[2023-11-01T10:05:35] Adebola Adeyemi: Of course, and that's important. I recommend starting with a demo or trial of these products if you'd like to get a hands-on feel. That way, you can see their value firsthand before fully committing.
[2023-11-01T10:05:50] Fatou Bamba: A demo sounds like a great idea. Let's arrange that so I can better understand how these can help us.
[2023-11-01T10:06:05] Adebola Adeyemi: Absolutely, I'll set that up for you. Do you have any other questions or concerns at this stage?
[2023-11-01T10:06:15] Fatou Bamba: No, I think you've covered it all. Thanks, Adebola.
[2023-11-01T10:06:25] Adebola Adeyemi: My pleasure, Fatou. I'll be in touch soon with details about the demo. Have a great day!
[2023-11-01T10:06:30] Fatou Bamba: Thanks, you too. Bye!", 'CreatedDate': '2023-11-01T10:02:10.000+0000'}]

instruction:
You are an expert in Salesforce and you have access to a Salesforce instance. 

# Instructions
- You will be provided a question, the system description, and relevant task context.
- Interact with the Salesforce instance to build Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) or Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) queries as appropriate, to help you answer the question.
- Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL) can be used to construct text-based search queries against the search index.
- Your generation should always be an Action command and NOTHING ELSE. Generate only one Action command.
- DO NOT generate ANY system observation, you will receive this based on your Action command.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.
- If the user's request is unclear or under-specified, use the respond action to ask for clarification before proceeding with queries or submitting an answer.

Here is a description of how to use this command:
## Action
- Can be 'execute' or 'submit'.
- execute, to execute SOQL that will return the observation from running the query on the Salesforce instance.
- submit, to return the final answer of the task to the user.
- Format: <execute> a valid SOQL query </execute> or <respond> user response </respond>

# Guidelines
- Execute SOQL/SOSL queries to understand the Salesforce instance that will help you find the answer to the question.
- When you are confident about the answer, submit it.
- Always end with a submit action containing ONLY the answer, NO full sentence or any explanation.
- If no record is found matching the requirements mentioned, just return 'None'.

# Example 1
Question: What is the total number of opportunities?
Output:
<execute> SELECT COUNT() FROM Opportunity </execute>
     (If the observation from the Salesforce instance 100, your next step can be)
<respond> 100 </respond> OR <respond> The total number of opportunities is 100 </respond>

# Example 2

  - Id: ID of the voice call transcript
  - LeadId__c: ID of the lead associated with this voice call transcript. References Lead object
  - OpportunityId__c: ID of the opportunity associated with this voice call transcript. References Opportunity object
Task
  - ActivityDate: Date when the task is due, in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Description: Detailed description of the task
  - Id: ID of the task

  - Priority: Priority of the task. One of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High', 'Urgent']
  - Status: Status of the task. One of ['Not Started', 'In Progress', 'Completed', 'Deferred', 'Waiting']
  - Subject: Subject of the task
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this task. References Opportunity object
Event
  - Description: Detailed description of the event

  - Id: ID of the event
  - IsAllDayEvent: Boolean to mark if the event is an all-day event
  - Location: Location of the event

  - Subject: Subject of the event
  - WhatId: ID of the opportunity associated with this event. References Opportunity object
Territory2
  - Description: A comma separated list of territories/states (e.g. CA,IL,AL)
  - Id: ID of the territory
  - Name: Name of the territory
UserTerritory2Association
  - Id: ID of the user territory association
  - Territory2Id: ID of the territory associated with the agent. References Territory2 object
  - UserId: ID of the agent who is associated with the territory. References User object
Lead
  - Company: Company name of the lead
  - ConvertedAccountId: ID of the Account record created when the Lead is converted. References Account object
  - ConvertedContactId: ID of the Contact record created when the Lead is converted. References Contact object
  - ConvertedDate: Date when the lead was converted in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format
  - CreatedDate: Date when the lead was created in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format
  - Email: Email address of the lead

  - Id: ID of the lead
  - IsConverted: Boolean indicating whether the lead has been converted
  - LastName: Last name of the lead

  - Phone: Phone number of the lead

# Salesforce instance Metadata
